It's not always an option, nor is i=
t necessarily the right thing to do.

Once you have your business logic, yo=
u want to be able to test it "as is",
no matter how well or how bad designe=
d it is.

At any rate, the testing framework should give you the option.  Y=
ou
shouldn't have to modify your production code just to accomodate the whi=
ms
of a testing framework (note that this claim is different from "write yo=
ur
production code to make it as easy to test as possible").
